books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Thomas Hardy
books.summary: A collection of Thomas Hardy’s short stories, mostly ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Special Correspondent
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A Parisian news reporter is assigned to travel across Asia by train and report on the sights, experiences, and interesting characters along the way.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Darby O’Gill and the Good People
books.author: Herminie Templeton Kavanagh
books.summary: When Tipperary man Darby O’Gill is imprisoned by the fairies of Sleive-na-mon in their home under the hollow mountain, he starts a lasting friendship with their King Brian Connors.

books.title: Fanny’s First Play
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A young woman writes a play to shock her father, in which two respectable families deal with their with disreputable children.

books.title: The Trachiniae
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A woman unintentionally kills her demigod husband with a poisoned robe in a desperate attempt to reclaim his love.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: Modeste Mignon
books.author: Honoré de Balzac
books.summary: A young daughter seeks independence on her own terms.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: The Lives of the Caesars
books.author: Suetonius
books.summary: The lives of the twelve emperors called Caesar are described in detail by a near-contemporary Roman historian.

books.title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Wollstonecraft argues for equal treatment of women in society, especially in matters of education.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Wilfred Owen
books.summary: A collection of Wilfred Owen’s published poems.

books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: A Strange Manuscript Found in a Copper Cylinder
books.author: James De Mille
books.summary: A shipwrecked sailor travels through a portal to a lost world populated by fantastic creatures and a strange civilization.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Xavier de Maistre
books.summary: A collection of Xavier de Maistre’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
